items.summary: Record a completed-playthrough result when (and only when) the user wins a game, capturing both (a) elapsed time in seconds from the game timer and (b) the current drag-move counter value for that playthrough.
Persist the history of recorded playthrough results on the client so the results remain available across page reloads (e.g., using localStorage), and load the persisted results on app start.

Compile and display two separate ranked lists derived from the recorded playthrough results: (1) Best Times ranked by lower completion time first, and (2) Best Moves ranked by fewer moves first. Each list entry must show both the primary metric and the other metric for that same playthrough (e.g., a time-ranked entry also shows its moves).

Update the win UI so that, when the win dialog is shown, it includes the current playthroughâ€™s completion time and moves, plus the two ranked lists (Best Times and Best Moves) in the same dialog or immediately adjacent UI section, using English labels.
